review: Amazon Fire TV Stick is very easy to use. Because I have a Prime account it came already knowing my info. So I just had to plug it in and let it find my WFI and off we went. Love it.
author: D. Hansen

review: I bought the Fire TV Stick as I thought it might be the next generation Chromecast, which I have had for about a year. The Chromecast is easy easy easy to use, and I love it. The Firestick is difficult, complicated and unpleasant to use. When I compare the two on a scale of one to ten, I give the Fire Stick a one and the Chromecast a 9.5. I finally just threw the fire stick out. So DON'T BOTHER WITH THIS PRODUCT. IT IS A LOUSY PRODUCT. Buy the Chromecast instead.
author: Laura E.

review: Lack of Youtube support is a major downer for me.
author: Vasudevan Nagalingam

review: I don't know what Amazon was thinking with this "feature": I was in the middle of watching a movie in the Netflix app, and the Fire TV Stick decided that it was time to install a system update... so it did so, without asking permission, shutting down Netflix, installing the update over several minutes, and rebooting.  In the middle of the movie.  Without asking if I'd like to do it now or later.This thing has ONE job: to let me watch stuff.  And it failed.
